Sat., Oct. 28: Learn and share ways to address and de-escalate street harassment.
  


Active Bystander Intervention Training

Saturday, October 28, 1-4 p.m.
Cobscook Community
Learning Center
10 Commissary Point Rd.
Lubec, ME 04652

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Take your activism to the next level! Join us on Saturday, October 28 for an Active Bystander Intervention Training and learn how you can address and de-escalate street harassment.

Street harassment is ever present for many people in our communities. Learn and share ways to address this form of assault when you are the target and when you witness others being targeted. Explore how to intervene directly, indirectly, and through distraction, and ways to de-escalate volatile situations.

This training is open to all members, ages 16 and up. Registration required, space is limited. For questions, contact Marena Blanchard at mblanchard@aclumaine.org or by calling 207-774-5444.

A special note to our Washington County members: Jensen Cook, our new statewide field strategist will be in Lubec for this event. Even if you can't attend the training, please feel free to stop by anytime from 12-1 p.m. or 4-5 p.m. to meet Jensen and talk about your priority issues!

Sincerely,

ACLU of Maine
